ruby?

We use Frapi right now.  Ran into a few issues, but generally works well.
However, your concerns over the project's activity are warranted.  Here's a thread on the issue from 12 months ago http://forums.recessframework.org/topic/102-is-recess-dead/
Recess is a great framework and I've put it into production for paying clients.
Hi, I've been involved with Recess for about 3 years now.
I've played around with symfony and like it - symfony 2 is in pre-release with a release targeted for next month - may be worth checking out for your project

I'm working on my own framework right now. It's PHP 5.3 specific and database agnostic. Resource oriented (ie. REST). Uses Mustache. Might use Dojo depending on how front-heavy it gets. You can sign up for release notification here http://torophp.net
Silex is a standalone framework that is part of Symfony2 that you can use to build super simple REST APIs https://github.com/fabpot/Silex
